item.title: Projection
item.description: projection $p = \hat{x}a$ $e = b - \hat{x}a$ $a\perp e \to a^T(b-\hat{x}a)=a^Tb - \hat{x}a^Ta = 0 \to \hat{x}=\frac{a^Tb}{a^Ta}$ $p = \hat{x}a = a\frac{a^Tb}{a^Ta}$ $p = Pb = \frac{aa^T}{a^Ta}b \to P = \frac{aa^T}{a^Ta}$ $P = P^T$, $P = P^2$ $P$ is a line trough $a$. why projection? Because $Ax = b$ may have no solution. So we may find a $p$ closest to $b$ that makes $A\hat{x} = p$ do have solution.
